Copying 5.3/6.0 Folders to Project Databases

You can copy a 5.3/6.0 Version Manager folder to any open project or project database. The location you select to copy an item into depends upon the item you are copying. Refer to the copy matrix for more information.

If you copy a folder to a project database, the folder is upgraded to a Version Manager project. You can then work with the contents of the folder using any of the functionality in the current version of Version Manager. The original folder and its contents remain unmodified.

To copy a folder to a project database:

  1. In the Project pane, select the folder you want to copy.

  2. Select Edit | Copy. The Copy Folder dialog box appears.

  3. Select a destination project database, project, or subproject and click Next. A second Copy Folder dialog box appears.

  4. Choose one of the following archive locations:

    To... Do this...
    Continue using the archives in the location defined by the 5.3/6.0 project root. Keep the default option, Use existing archive location, selected.
    Copy the archives to the project database location and update only these archives when checking in workfiles (the original archives will not be updated). Select the option Copy archives to project location.


  5. Click Finish.
